In class Exercise 3 - Interactive Data Visualisation

Plotting of exam_data dataset, below:

# A tibble: 6 Ã— 7
  ID         CLASS GENDER RACE    ENGLISH MATHS SCIENCE
  <chr>      <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Student321 3I    Male   Malay        21     9      15
2 Student305 3I    Female Malay        24    22      16
3 Student289 3H    Male   Chinese      26    16      16
4 Student227 3F    Male   Chinese      27    77      31
5 Student318 3I    Male   Malay        27    11      25
6 Student306 3I    Female Malay        31    16      16
  1. Scatterplot of Maths against English with hover effects. Colours represent class
p1 <- plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
             x = ~MATHS, 
             y = ~ENGLISH,
        color=~CLASS)
  1. Scatterplot of Maths against Science with hover effects. Colours represent class.
p2 <- plot_ly(data = exam_data, 
             x = ~MATHS, 
             y = ~SCIENCE,
        color=~CLASS)
  1. Bringing it all together (side by side)
subplot(ggplotly(p1),ggplotly(p2))
